mostRelevantFaqs.subTitle: We are constantly striving to improve!

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.intro: Here you will find answers to the most frequently asked questions. We are constantly striving to improve!

support.question: I have questions, feedback, a problem or found a bug. What should I do?
support.answer: Don't hesitate to contact us at {supportEmail}.

monitorCards.question: How can I track which cards have been redeemed?
monitorCards.answer: Go to the page where you created your TipCards set. In the upper part you will see an overview of all cards in your set that have been funded, viewed and redeemed.

getBackSats.question: How can I get unused sats back?
getBackSats.answer: On the page of your TipCards set, you will find a button "Withdraw remaining sats". It will allow you to redeem all cards of this set that still have some value on them at once. You need to be logged in to use this feature.

bulkFunding.question: Can I fund multiple cards at once?
bulkFunding.answer: Just click on "Fund set" on the set's configuration page and type in the amount of sats per card. You can fund up to 100 cards with one lightning transaction.

custodial.question: Is TipCards a custodial service?
custodial.answer: Lightning TipCards is a custodial service and should not be used as a long-term storage for your sats. We highly recommend not to leave a significant amount on a TipCard for a longer time.

lightningNode.question: Which Lightning node are you using?
lightningNode.answer: We are using the Lightning node {lightningNode}.

openSource.question: Can I host TipCards myself? Is the code open source?
openSource.answer: Yes. You are free to setup your own version of Lightning TipCards or to support us by creating issues, contributing translations, bug fixes or new features via Pull Requests on {github}.

localStorageSets.question: Where are my old sets?
localStorageSets.answer: If you saved sets before September 2023, they were stored locally in your browser. You can go to {localSetsPage} to view them. We would recommend you to save them into your account, so that you can get access to them from any device.

about.title: About Lightning TipCards
about.intro: Lightning TipCards are a system for tip or gift cards. You can fund the cards with Bitcoin via the Lightning Network, and the recipient can then redeem them. The recipient receives a brief introduction to Bitcoin and a recommendation for a Lightning app to start their journey into the Bitcoin rabbit hole.

openSource.title: Open Source
openSource.text: You are free to setup your own version of Lightning TipCards or to support us by creating issues, contributing translations, bug fixes or new features via Pull Requests on Github.

text.2: This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

text.1: Please note that Lightning TipCards is a custodial service and should not be used as a long-term storage for your sats. We highly recommend NOT to leave a significant amount on a TipCard for a longer time.
text.2: In the unlikely case we ever need to take down our service, we will keep your sats available to withdraw for another 6 months and afterwards donate the remaining to one or more organizations of our choice.
text.3: If you want to use TipCards using your own Lightning node, you can use our open source code and set up your own instance of Lightning TipCards.
